intro: Acleisanthes longiflora subsp. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy long-flowered acleisanthes, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its subspecific name, *hirtella*, refers to the hairy texture of its stems and leaves.
